**Area Detection and Identification System (ADIS)**
=====================================================

**Title** (English/French)
---------------------------

* Area Detection and Identification System (ADIS)/Système de détection et d’identification à distance
* Solicitation Number/W8476-18ADIS/E
* Reference Number/PW-22-01016323

**Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) Procurement Notice**
================================================================

The Department of National Defence (DND) has authorized Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) to procure the Area Detection and Identification System (ADIS) on its behalf. The project aims to acquire 32 stand-off chemical detection and identification systems to support the integration of Government Supplied Equipment (GSE) and provide operational and maintenance training services, as well as in-service support.

**Procurement Details**
-----------------------

* Procurement Method: Competitive, Open Bidding
* Procurement Category: Goods and Services
* Tender Status: Expired (Closing Date: February 16, 2023)
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: None

**Security Requirements**
------------------------

The procurement is subject to security requirements related to personal and organization security screening, and security clauses as outlined in Volume 1 - Part 6, Volume 2 - Resulting Acquisition Contract Clauses, and Volume 3 - Resulting In-Service Support Contract Clauses.

**Industrial and Technological Benefits (ITB) Policy**
---------------------------------------------------

The procurement is subject to the ITB Policy, including a Value Proposition (VP) related to both the ADIS Acquisition and In-Service Support requirements. The successful contractor is expected to provide Industrial and Technological Benefits to maximize business activities for Canadian industry.

**Federal Contractors Program (FCP) for Employment Equity**
---------------------------------------------------------

The FCP for Employment Equity applies to this procurement. Refer to Part 5 - Certifications and Additional Information for more details.

**Notice URL and Attachments**
-----------------------------

Please visit the Government of Canada's tendering website for more information and attachments related to this procurement.
